alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Iron; Kane; Piute; Sevier (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 6:13AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Sevier River Near Hatch affecting Sevier, Kane, Piute, Garfield and Iron Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack, causing elevated flows. For the Sevier River...including Hatch...Moderate flooding will continue. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding will continue through at least May 26th. Thereafter flows are expected to fall back into a minor flood stage. * WHERE...Sevier River Near Hatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 3.9 feet (1046 cfs), minor flooding will affect fields. Assorted bridges and select low lying structures will receive minor flood damage. At 4.3 feet (1353 cfs), moderate flooding will affect fields, roads and bridges along low lying stretches of the Sevier River including the river crossing along the South Hatch Dam Road. Additionally, structures in low lying areas will receive flood damage including seasonal homes near Bullberry Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 4.5 feet. - The river stage is increasing and is at the highest level of the snowmelt season so far. - Forecast...The river stage may increase this morning before beginning to fall to near 4.3 feet by this evening. The current stage is the highest of the snowmelt season and any increase may cause flooding issues in new locations. The river stage will continue above moderate flood stage through May 26, falling to minor flood stage through at least early June. - Flood stage is 3.9 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
